Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll

Class CourseRoll

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll.CourseRoll
public class CourseRoll
extends java.lang.Object
The CourseRoll class is in charge of handling everything to do with a student enrolling in a course Our fields are the enrollmentCapacity of a class we have a LinkedAbstractList called roll which contains the students we also have fields for the minimum amount of students that can enroll and maximum amount of students that can enroll Inside the constructor we pass in a potential enrollment capacity for students in a class we then delegate to the setter methods which check for valid inputs in addition, in this class we can enroll students drop students get the amount of open seats in a class and check the boolean method canEnroll to see if it is possible for a student to enroll The CourseRoll method's are integrated into Course where it is now a parameter for the constructs the enrollment capacity has been added to the Coure's toString() method
Author:
Kennedy, Armando, Kiran, Ethan

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    CourseRoll​(Course c, int enrollmentCap)
    The constructor sets the enrollment cap via the setEnrollmentCap method all the error checking is handled inside the method a new empty LinkedAbstractList of students with capacity enrollmentCap is created

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean canEnroll​(Student s)
    This boolean method checks if a student can be added to the courseRoll we start by checking if the class is full, if so, we return false because the student can not enroll we then check to see if the student is a duplicate, if so, we return false if we pass both checks, we return true and this means the student can enroll
    void drop​(Student s)
    This method removes a student from the LinkedAbstractList we start by checking for invalid values for the student object if the student is null, we throw an IAe otherwise we attempt to remove the student, catch any exceptions if there are any and throw an IAE
    void enroll​(Student s)
    The enroll method enrolls a student in the LinkedAbstractList we start by checking for invalid student objects if the student is null we throw an IAE if the size of the list is equal to the enrollemntCap field, we throw an IAE because there is no more room in the class if the student is a duplicate of one in the list, we throw an IAE Otherwise we add the student to the list and catch any exceptions and throw an IAE
    int getEnrollmentCap()
    This method gets the enrollmentCap field
    int getNumberOnWaitlist()
    This method is responsible for getting the number of students in the waitlist, we return the size field of the waitlist
    int getOpenSeats()
    This method is responsible for getting the amount of opens seats in a class we do this by using the enrollmentCap field and subtracting the size of the LinkedAbstractList roll to give us the availability
    void setEnrollmentCap​(int enrollmentCap)
    The setEnrollmentCap method checks for a valid parameter enrollmentCap if the enrollmentCap is less than the field MIN_EROLLMENT or if it is greater than the field MAX_ENROLLMENT we throw an IAE We then check to ensure that roll has been constructed and that the size of the list is not greater than the enrollment cap if the enrollmentCap is less than the size, we throw an IAE if the enrollmentCap parameter passes the tests, we set it to be the enrollmentCap field

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • CourseRoll

      public CourseRoll​(Course c, int enrollmentCap)
      The constructor sets the enrollment cap via the setEnrollmentCap method all the error checking is handled inside the method a new empty LinkedAbstractList of students with capacity enrollmentCap is created
      Parameters:
      c - is the course for which the CourseRoll is associated with
      enrollmentCap - is being passed in to potentially be the capacity for the LinkedAbstractList after passing error checking
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the enrollmentCap is not valid per the setEnrollmentCap method

  • Method Details

    • setEnrollmentCap

      public void setEnrollmentCap​(int enrollmentCap)
      The setEnrollmentCap method checks for a valid parameter enrollmentCap if the enrollmentCap is less than the field MIN_EROLLMENT or if it is greater than the field MAX_ENROLLMENT we throw an IAE We then check to ensure that roll has been constructed and that the size of the list is not greater than the enrollment cap if the enrollmentCap is less than the size, we throw an IAE if the enrollmentCap parameter passes the tests, we set it to be the enrollmentCap field
      Parameters:
      enrollmentCap - is being checked and after passing our tests, it is set to the field enrollmentCap
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the enrollmentCap is less than the list size or if its value is out of bounds via the checks with the enrollment fields

    • getEnrollmentCap

      public int getEnrollmentCap()
      This method gets the enrollmentCap field
      Returns:
      enrollmentCap is the field to represent the enrollment capacity

    • enroll

      public void enroll​(Student s)
      The enroll method enrolls a student in the LinkedAbstractList we start by checking for invalid student objects if the student is null we throw an IAE if the size of the list is equal to the enrollemntCap field, we throw an IAE because there is no more room in the class if the student is a duplicate of one in the list, we throw an IAE Otherwise we add the student to the list and catch any exceptions and throw an IAE
      Parameters:
      s - is the student object which after passing all the error checks, we add the the LinkedAbstractList
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the student is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the student is a duplicate
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is any issues with adding the student to the list

    • drop

      public void drop​(Student s)
      This method removes a student from the LinkedAbstractList we start by checking for invalid values for the student object if the student is null, we throw an IAe otherwise we attempt to remove the student, catch any exceptions if there are any and throw an IAE
      Parameters:
      s - is the student object to the removed
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the student object is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are any issues with removing a student from the list

    • canEnroll

      public boolean canEnroll​(Student s)
      This boolean method checks if a student can be added to the courseRoll we start by checking if the class is full, if so, we return false because the student can not enroll we then check to see if the student is a duplicate, if so, we return false if we pass both checks, we return true and this means the student can enroll
      Parameters:
      s - is the student object being passed in which can potentially enroll after passing checks
      Returns:
      false if the student can not enroll per the error checks, returns true if the student passes the error checks and can enroll

    • getOpenSeats

      public int getOpenSeats()
      This method is responsible for getting the amount of opens seats in a class we do this by using the enrollmentCap field and subtracting the size of the LinkedAbstractList roll to give us the availability
      Returns:
      openSeats is the amount of open seats available in a class

    • getNumberOnWaitlist

      public int getNumberOnWaitlist()
      This method is responsible for getting the number of students in the waitlist, we return the size field of the waitlist
      Returns:
      waitlist.size() is the number of students in the waitlist
